introduction: A gnat got into your eye, and you got it out. You feel you might have a minor abrasion, which you washed out with water. You've heard that minor scratches will heal on their own. You don't remember how long that will take and at what time you will need to see a doctor.
question: How long does a minor cornea injury take to heal without medical attention?

answers.text: Most corneal injuries heal in 24 to 72 hours.

ref.title: Management of corneal abrasions
ref.text: Review in Am Fam Physician. 2004 Jul 1; University of Pittsburgh Medical Center St. Margaret Family Practice Residency Program, Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania 15215, USA. wilsons2@upmc.edu

answers.text: If the injury is greater than 4mm and vision is not getting better, a doctor should evaluate it again after 24 hours.

ref.title: When should I get urgent care for a scratched cornea?

answers.text: Severe injuries might need two weeks of treatment or more.
